name: Airseeker (RC-135W)
description: The RC-135W Airseeker provides real-time signals intelligence and surveillance to support theater and national level consumers.

name: Airbus A400M Atlas
description: The Atlas C1 provides tactical airlift and strategic oversized cargo capabilities, filling the gap between the C-130 and C-17.

name: BAE Hawk T2
payload: Advanced glass cockpit for fast jet training
weapons: Practice bombs and AIM-9L Sidewinder capability
description: Used for advanced fast jet pilot training, mimicking the cockpit environments of Typhoon and F-35.

name: Bell Boeing V-22 Osprey
payload: 24 seated troops or 9,070 kg internal cargo
description: A multi-role, tiltrotor military aircraft with both vertical takeoff and landing (VTOL) and short takeoff and landing (STOL) capabilities.

name: Boeing AH-64D Apache
weapons: 30mm Chain Gun, Hellfire missiles, CRV7 rockets
description: A high-performance attack helicopter designed to hunt and destroy tanks and support ground troops.

name: Boeing E-7 Wedgetail
payload: MESA Active Electronically Scanned Array Radar
description: Provides powerful long-range air surveillance and control, acting as a command center in the sky.

name: C-17 Globemaster III
description: The backbone of strategic heavy lift, capable of rapid delivery of troops and all types of cargo to main operating bases.

name: C-130J Hercules
description: The workhorse of tactical airlift, capable of operating from unprepared runways for rapid response.

name: Chinook CH-47
description: An extremely versatile heavy-lift helicopter used for troop movement, casualty evacuation, and logistics.

name: EC135 Juno
description: The Juno HT1 is used for basic rotary wing pilot training within the Defence Helicopter Flying School.

name: F-15 Eagle
weapons: 20mm M61A1 Vulcan, AIM-120, AIM-9X, Paveway series
description: An all-weather, extremely maneuverable tactical fighter designed to gain and maintain air supremacy.

name: F-16 Fighting Falcon
weapons: 20mm M61A1 Vulcan, AIM-120 AMRAAM, AIM-9 Sidewinder
description: A highly maneuverable, multi-role fighter designed for air-to-air combat and air-to-surface attack.

name: F-22 Raptor
description: A 5th-generation stealth tactical fighter aircraft, widely considered the premier air superiority fighter in the world.

name: F-35 Lightning II
weapons: AIM-120 AMRAAM, Paveway IV, 25mm GAU-22 Cannon
description: A 5th Generation stealth multi-role fighter combining advanced sensors and mission systems.

name: F/A-18 Hornet
description: A versatile combat-proven multi-role fighter for carrier-based or land-based operations.

name: Grob G 115 Tutor
description: Used for elementary flying training, providing the first experience of flight for RAF students.

name: Protector RG Mk1
weapons: Brimstone missiles, Paveway IV laser-guided bombs
description: The next generation of Remotely Piloted Air System (RPAS), providing persistent surveillance and strike capability.

name: Typhoon FGR4
description: A highly capable and extremely agile multi-role combat aircraft, used for air-to-air and air-to-surface operations.

name: Voyager KC Mk2
description: The RAF's sole air-to-air refuelling (AAR) tanker and strategic air transport aircraft.
